transportAdvice: A single public bus route circles the island in both directions and covers most tourist areas, making it a practical and affordable option for getting around. Taxis are available, scooter and bicycle rentals are popular, and many resorts and attractions are accessible on foot along the coastal road.

weather.description: Peak of the wet season with warm temperatures, frequent tropical downpours, and the highest cyclone risk of the year.
Continues hot and humid with heavy rainfall and ongoing cyclone risk; expect lush green landscapes.
Still firmly in the wet season with warm, sticky conditions and regular afternoon showers.
Rainfall begins to ease as the wet season winds down, though humidity remains high and showers are still common.
Transitional month with noticeably drier and more comfortable conditions as the dry season approaches.
The dry season begins with pleasant, cooler temperatures and lower humidity â€” ideal for outdoor activities.
One of the coolest and driest months of the year, with comfortable temperatures and plenty of sunshine.
Consistently dry and sunny with mild temperatures, making it one of the most popular months for visitors.
Dry season continues with warm, sunny days and refreshing trade winds keeping conditions comfortable.
Temperatures begin to climb again as the dry season draws to a close, with mostly fine and sunny weather.
The wet season starts to return with increasing cloud cover and occasional showers alongside warm temperatures.
Hot and increasingly humid with more frequent rain as the wet season builds toward its summer peak.
